snippet: Vice President Farouk al-Shara was removed from the government as Ghassan Hitto resigned his post in the opposition movement.
abstract: Syria’s governing Baath Party removes Vice President Farouk al-Shara from its top decision-making body after the Syrian political insider had come close  to publicly criticizing government's handling of the two-year uprising; move comes as Ghassan Hitto, prime minister of opposition's interim government, resigns in what is new setback for Syria's National Coalition for Syrian Revolutionary and Opposition Forces.

byline.contributor: An employee of The New York Times contributed reporting from Damascus, Syria, and Hania Mourtada from Beirut.

lead_paragraph: Vice President Farouk al-Shara was removed from the government as Ghassan Hitto resigned his post in the opposition movement.

headline.main: Syrian Governing Party Ousts a Political Insider
headline.print_headline: Syrian Governing Party Ousts a Political Insider
